question: If <katex>$P=[\begin{matrix}1&a&3\\ 1&3&3\\ 2&4&4\end{matrix}]$</katex> is the adjoint of a <katex>$3\times3$</katex> matrix A and <katex>$|A|=4.$</katex>, then a is equal to
explanation: <katex>$|P| = |A|^2 = 16$</katex>. Calculating determinant of P gives <katex>$2a-6$</katex>. <katex>$2a-6=16 \implies a=11$</katex>.
